Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 09:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power restored

UKPNIncident.PlannedIncidentReason: Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power to allow them to safely connect a new supply to the electricity network. Following recent planning our engineers have been granted access to the substation which will enable them to safely connect a new building to our electiricity network. We have a duty to connect all customers who apply for electricity, to our network. Once the work is completed this will ensure there is enough electricity to uphold the electricity being used within the area, preventing unplanned power cuts. This is why It is important to complete during the coronavirus pandemic. The government has given exemptions to certain industries and activities, this outage falls into this category. We estimate the power to be off for 3 hours but if the engineers will do all they can to get the power back on sooner. This work is taking place at our substation located in the basement of 27-32 Old Jewry.
